aspect: 1. MP Bob Katter accuses Queensland Government of believing Billy Gordon is a "black puppet on a string".
2. Katter says Government assumed Gordon would resign after domestic violence accusations.
3. Katter calls Gordon a "puppet" due to personal experiences with racism.
4. Katter defends statement, says he used "black puppet" term to call out racism.
5. Katter says Gordon won't make the same mistake as federal MPs and become a puppet.
explain: According to MP Bob Katter's accusation, the Queensland Government believes that Billy Gordon is a "black puppet on a string" and is being controlled by external forces.
The aspect states that Bob Katter said the government believed that the former NSW premier, Bob Carr would resign after being accused of domestic violence.

The aspect states that Bob Katter calls Mr. Gordon a "puppet" due to personal experiences with racism. Bob Katter, being a Federal MP for Kennedy, is of Lebanese descent and has faced personal experiences with racism from both major parties in the past. Katter sympathizes with Mr. Gordon's position and believes that he will quit after an accusation of domestic violence.

One of the most talked about statements made by Bob Katter in relation to the government, their handling of the Gordon saga was his comment that the government believed that the former Labor senator Sam Dastyari would "shoot himself in the foot." Bob Katter said that this comment showed the government's lack of awareness and empathy towards the situation. Bob Katter also revealed that he is of Lebanese descent and that he had been subjected to racist attitudes by politicians from both major parties in the past. This aspect highlights the lack of sensitivity of the government towards the issue of racism and how Bob Katter was trying to showcase it through his comment.

The aspect states that Bob Katter said George Gordon would not make the same mistake as federal MPs and become a puppet. This means that Katter believes that Gordon will stand up for himself and not let others manipulate him.
